title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
SummaryPosted: Jan 7, 2025Role Number:200585698The Apple Information Security Business Intelligence team delivers metrics and information to support the decision making across the Information Security organization. We are seeking an extraordinary Business Intelligence Developer who can thrive in an environment where both individual drive and team collaboration are critical. In this role, you will be responsible for the architecture, development, maintenance, and support of the BI team‚Äôs web site, web-based data visualization and analytical tools.DescriptionThe Business Intelligence team‚Äôs web site is central to delivering key information, metrics, and related resources to the Apple Information Security organization. The Business Intelligence Developer is primarily responsible for the site front-end. The ideal candidate must excel at researching solutions and collaborating across Information Security and other Apple organizations in support of the BI team‚Äôs mission.  
* Collaborate with partner teams, such as SRE for site hosting and managing CI/CD pipelines 
* Collaborate with the Data Engineers, Analysts, and other resources to deliver and maintain metrics 
* Validate technical feasibility of proposed features 
* Develop and ensure the quality of site features 
* Create and enhance web-based data visualizations and analytical tools 
* Implement integrations with existing tools and platforms to extend the functionality of the BI web site 
* Ensure site availability and address critical issues

This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $166,600 and $250,600, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Full Time Mid-level / Intermediate USD 166K - 250K

Apple

We‚Äôre a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what‚Äôs possible to help us all do what we love in new ways.

View all jobs at Apple

Apply now Apply later

Posted 1 week ago

Summary

Posted: Jan 7, 2025

Role Number:200585698

The Apple Information Security Business Intelligence team delivers metrics and information to support the decision making across the Information Security organization. We are seeking an extraordinary Business Intelligence Developer who can thrive in an environment where both individual drive and team collaboration are critical. In this role, you will be responsible for the architecture, development, maintenance, and support of the BI team‚Äôs web site, web-based data visualization and analytical tools.

Description


The Business Intelligence team‚Äôs web site is central to delivering key information, metrics, and related resources to the Apple Information Security organization. The Business Intelligence Developer is primarily responsible for the site front-end. The ideal candidate must excel at researching solutions and collaborating across Information Security and other Apple organizations in support of the BI team‚Äôs mission. * Collaborate with partner teams, such as SRE for site hosting and managing CI/CD pipelines * Collaborate with the Data Engineers, Analysts, and other resources to deliver and maintain metrics * Validate technical feasibility of proposed features * Develop and ensure the quality of site features * Create and enhance web-based data visualizations and analytical tools * Implement integrations with existing tools and platforms to extend the functionality of the BI web site * Ensure site availability and address critical issues * Learn and adapt to new technologies and topics as needed

Minimum Qualifications


  • Comfortably and quickly adapt to changes in priorities to best support the needs of our business
  • Ability to thrive in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment
  • Self-motivated with a passion for operational excellence, quality, and attention to detail
  • 5+ years professional experience in web development
  • 2+ years professional experience using HighCharts to deliver data visualizations
  • Experience with developing websites by leveraging design systems and React component libraries
  • Able to quickly and independently troubleshoot production web application issues
  • 3+ years professional experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS
  • React, including Next.js, Server Side Components, Lifecycle Hooks
  • MongoDB, including, Mongoose schemas, pipeline and view creation, query syntax, maintenance (performance tuning, database health, migration, and backup)
  • AWS SDK
  • CI/CD Pipelines


Preferred Qualifications


  • Experience working in an Information Security domain
  • Proficiency with Python
  • Strong understanding of ETL concepts and tools
  • Experience implementing and leveraging site traffic reporting and analytics
  • Experience using D3 for data visualizations
  • Experience using and releasing open source software in corporate environments, with knowledge of licensing and legal review processes.


Pay & Benefits


  • At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $166,600 and $250,600, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

    Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

    Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.



  • Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.




Apply now Apply later
